summary.span: 命名空間包含可用於實作語音辨識的 Windows Desktop Speech 技術型別。

span.span: The namespace contains Windows Desktop Speech technology types for implementing speech recognition.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Windows 桌面語音技術軟體提供基本的語音辨識基礎結構，digitizes acoustical 訊號，並從音訊的輸入來復原文字和語音項目。The Windows Desktop Speech Technology software offers a basic speech recognition infrastructure that digitizes acoustical signals, and recovers words and speech elements from audio input. 應用程式使用命名空間來存取及擴充此基本的語音辨識技術，藉由定義的演算法來識別，並根據特定的片語或單字模式，並藉由管理這個語音的執行階段行為基礎結構。Applications use the namespace to access and extend this basic speech recognition technology by defining algorithms for identifying and acting on specific phrases or word patterns, and by managing the runtime behavior of this speech infrastructure. **建立文法****Create Grammars** 您建立包含一組規則或條件約束，來定義做為有意義的輸入的單字和片語，且您的應用程式會辨識的文法。You create grammars, which consist of a set of rules or constraints, to define words and phrases that your application will recognize as meaningful input. 使用的建構函式類別，您可以在執行階段從建立的文法物件或執行個體，或從檔案、 字串或包含文法定義的資料流。Using a constructor for the class, you can create a grammar object at runtime from or instances, or from a file, a string, or a stream that contains a definition of a grammar. 使用和類別，您可以透過程式設計方式建立的低到中等複雜度，可用來執行許多一般案例的辨識文法。Using the and classes, you can programmatically create grammars of low to medium complexity that can be used to perform recognition for many common scenarios. 若要建立以程式設計的方式，符合的文法[語音辨識文法規格 1.0 (SRGS)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201761)善用 SRGS 撰寫彈性，使用的型別命名空間。To create grammars programmatically that conform to the [Speech Recognition Grammar Specification 1.0 (SRGS)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201761) and take advantage of the authoring flexibility of SRGS, use the types of the namespace. 您也可以建立 XML 格式 SRGS 文法使用任何文字編輯器，並使用結果來建立， ，或物件。You can also create XML-format SRGS grammars using any text editor and use the result to create , , or objects. 颾魤 ㄛ類別提供的特殊案例文法來支援傳統的聽寫的模型。In addition, the class provides a special-case grammar to support a conventional dictation model. 請參閱[建立文法](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dbea278c-21a5-4816-aee7-5fd88ef993dd)中[系統語音程式設計指南針對.NET Framework 4.0](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/610116c7-3817-40ff-857b-5d41e8511043)如需詳細資訊和範例。See [Create Grammars](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dbea278c-21a5-4816-aee7-5fd88ef993dd) in the [System Speech Programming Guide for .NET Framework 4.0](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/610116c7-3817-40ff-857b-5d41e8511043) for more information and examples. **管理語音辨識引擎****Manage Speech Recognition Engines** 執行個體並隨附物件提供的主要的存取權的 Windows 桌面語音技術的語音辨識 引擎。Instances of and supplied with objects provide the primary access to the speech recognition engines of the Windows Desktop Speech Technology. 您可以使用類別來建立用戶端應用程式，使用 Windows，您可以透過設定所提供的語音辨識技術**控制台**。You can use the class to create client applications that use the speech recognition technology provided by Windows, which you can configure through the **Control Panel**. 這類應用程式會接受輸入，透過電腦的預設音訊輸入機制。Such applications accept input through a computer's default audio input mechanism. 進一步控制辨識引擎的類型與組態的詳細資訊，建置應用程式使用，執行同處理序。For more control over the configuration and type of recognition engine, build an application using , which runs in-process. 使用類別，您可以也會動態地選取音訊輸入裝置、 檔案或資料流。Using the class, you can also dynamically select audio input from devices, files, or streams. 請參閱[初始化並管理語音辨識引擎](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6eed5b59-1258-4013-8a4c-a1ddabd93ae4)中[系統語音程式設計指南針對.NET Framework 4.0](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/610116c7-3817-40ff-857b-5d41e8511043)如需詳細資訊。See [Initialize and Manage a Speech Recognition Engine](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6eed5b59-1258-4013-8a4c-a1ddabd93ae4) in the [System Speech Programming Guide for .NET Framework 4.0](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/610116c7-3817-40ff-857b-5d41e8511043) for more information. **回應事件****Respond to Events** 和物件產生的事件以回應至語音辨識引擎的音訊輸入。 and objects generate events in response to audio input to the speech recognition engine. `AudioLevelUpdated`， `AudioSignalProblemOccurred`，`AudioStateChanged`事件會引發以回應傳入的訊號中的變更。The `AudioLevelUpdated`, `AudioSignalProblemOccurred`, `AudioStateChanged` events are raised in response to changes in the incoming signal. `SpeechDetected`語音辨識引擎識別為語音的連入音訊時引發事件。The `SpeechDetected` event is raised when the speech recognition engine identifies incoming audio as speech. 語音辨識引擎會引發`SpeechRecognized`事件時符合其已載入的文法的其中一個語音輸入，並引發`SpeechRecognitionRejected`當語音輸入不符合任何其已載入的文法。The speech recognition engine raises the `SpeechRecognized` event when it matches speech input to one of its loaded grammars, and raises the `SpeechRecognitionRejected` when speech input does not match any of its loaded grammars. 其他類型的事件包括`LoadGrammarCompleted`語音辨識引擎會載入文法時引發事件。Other types of events include the `LoadGrammarCompleted` event which a speech recognition engine raises when it has loaded a grammar. 是專為Windows 語音辨識的狀態變更時，引發事件的類別。The is exclusive to the class, which raises the event when the state of Windows Speech Recognition changes. 您可以註冊要收到通知的語音辨識引擎引發的事件，並使用建立處理常式`EventsArgs`與每個程式應用程式的行為，就會引發事件時事件相關聯的類別。You can register to be notified for events that the speech recognition engine raises and create handlers using the `EventsArgs` classes associated with each of these events to program your application's behavior when an event is raised. 請參閱[使用語音辨識事件](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01c598ca-2e0e-4e89-b303-cd1cef9e8482)中[系統語音程式設計指南針對.NET Framework 4.0](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/610116c7-3817-40ff-857b-5d41e8511043)如需詳細資訊。See [Using Speech Recognition Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01c598ca-2e0e-4e89-b303-cd1cef9e8482) in the [System Speech Programming Guide for .NET Framework 4.0](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/610116c7-3817-40ff-857b-5d41e8511043) for more information.
